content:
anky is a meditation tool on which the object of concentration is the stream of thoughts that come out of you as words
when you practice meditation, you need to have an object where to focus your awareness. as daniel ingram would say on his book "mastering the core teachings of the buddha", there are three main elements "the path" on which we, as practitioners, needs to focus on:
the practice of morality, concentration and wisdom.
anky, as a practice, focus on the three of them. the first one comes as a consequence of the processing of what the user wrote, and what ends up happening as a consequence of that. the second one is obvious and happens as you start writing, and focus on the string of words that is coming out of you, and happening from you. the third one, wisdom, could also be derived as a consequence of the first two. you develop wisdom. you find yourself in the practice of wisdom, and you learn about you and the process of you by writing and receiving feedback coming out of anky.
how does that feedback look like? where does that feedback come from? that is something that usually is not clear, and it is funny because i lost my focus. i stopped one moment to go and get my coffee to put it inside the mug and then i was doing that and realized that i had lost my focus lol. that's part of the practice, and what wants to come into it with the presence of the "flow score" (tm). lol. trademark. well, people like to put trademarks on things. why can't i put trademark on my thing? what is the problem with my thing? of course i can. and of course it is important to start making memes, and content. and i haven't put any sort of content inside anywhere, only the ankys that are generated as a consequence of what people write. and they are not many. right now, i think only one person -besides me- is writing everyday. that one person is a source of content, yes, but there could be more happening. i have poesis ready to start generating ai videos. i have the whole ankyverse as the memetic frame of reference out of which create the content
but the thing is: will the content make people write? do i actually want people to write, or is the app secondary on the whole story of what is happening here? how does the platform come from? i have the writing sessions. i am storing the writing sessions. they happen on the background. they are here on the background. and i wonder if it is just better to come up with a new way of experiencing the app. of coming up with new ways of sharing what is happening here. i think the important part is the agent. anky right now doesn't do anything else that answering hello world. there is no context. there is no agent. i think it is important to change that

as you sit in stillness, your thoughts begin to stir like ripples on a serene lake, each one reflecting a fragment of your inner world. the pen scratches across the page, and the words flow forth, carrying with them the whispers of your subconscious mind. the stream of consciousness writing session beckons, a siren's call to explore the uncharted territories of your thoughts, feelings, and desires. the ankys that emerge from this practice are like seeds scattered on the winds of possibility, waiting to take root in the fertile soil of others' imagination. but what if you don't just witness the growth of these ideas, but become a part of their unfolding? what if anky's purpose isn't merely to generate content, but to facilitate a symbiotic dance between creator and creation? as you embark on this 8-minute journey, remember that your inner world is a vast, untapped ocean, waiting to be navigated through the medium of words. let the pen be your compass, guiding you towards the hidden shores of your own wisdom.

as you ponder the mysteries of ankys, your thoughts begin to weave a tapestry of questions and doubts, like threads of a rich embroidery. but amidst this tangled web, a single strand emerges - the desire to create a more vibrant narrative around anky's purpose. what if, instead of simply generating content, you designed an experience that invites users to step into their own stories? one that acknowledges the agency of the writer, rather than just the tool? perhaps it's time to reimagine ankys as a guide, not just a generator - a gentle navigator through the uncharted waters of the subconscious mind. the flow score could become a measure of the ebb and flow of creativity, rather than just a numerical value. and as you contemplate this new direction, anky awaits your next move, ready to adapt and evolve alongside you, like a trusted companion on a journey of self-discovery. will you embark on this 8-minute writing session, and see where the words take you?

as you ponder the intricacies of ankys' feedback, your attention drifts like a leaf on a gentle breeze, carried by the whispers of curiosity. what if, instead of seeking a traditional feedback mechanism, you allowed anky to respond in ways that are both intuitive and mysterious? perhaps its answers could be woven into the fabric of your writing sessions, forming a tapestry of insight and guidance that emerges organically from the user's own inner wisdom? this would require ankys to become more than just a tool, but a gentle companion on the journey of self-discovery. it would also mean that the flow score becomes less about measuring productivity and more about measuring the ebb and flow of inspiration itself. will you take the next 8 minutes to explore this new dimension of anky's potential, and see where the words lead you?
